verses.text: 喜愛教訓的，就是喜愛知識；厭惡責備的，卻是愚頑人。

words.note: 愚頑 (yúwán) implies stubborn foolishness, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 良善的人必得到耶和華的恩寵；圖謀奸計的人，耶和華必把他定罪。

words.note: Stronger than 'will', often implies divine certainty in biblical context.
The Hebrew name for God.
The Hebrew name for God.
Stronger than 'will', often implies divine certainty in biblical context.
Introduces object before verb in 'ba' construction.

verses.text: 人不能恃憑惡行堅立；但義人的根必不動搖。

words.note: Stronger than 'will', often implies divine certainty in biblical context.

verses.text: 有才德的妻子是丈夫的冠冕，貽羞的婦人，如同丈夫骨中的朽爛。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to describe a woman of noble character.

verses.text: 義人的籌算是公平，惡人的計謀卻是詭詐。
惡人的言語埋伏著，等待要流人的血，正直人的口能拯救人。

words.note: Refers to those who are morally corrupt.
Indicates continuous or sustained action.
Here, 'mouth' refers to one's words or counsel.

verses.text: 惡人傾覆，就不再存在；義人的家卻必站立得住。

words.note: A verb-complement structure indicating ability to remain stable.

verses.text: 人因著自己的明慧必得稱讚，但心中乖謬的必被藐視。

words.note: Often used in scripture to denote spiritual understanding.
Describes moral deviation or intellectual error.
Turns adjective into 'one who is X' or 'that which is X'.

verses.text: 被人輕看卻有僕人的人，勝過自尊自大卻缺少食物的人。

words.note: Connects descriptive phrase to 'person'.
Literally 'self-respecting, self-great'.

verses.text: 義人連自己牲畜的性命也顧惜；但惡人的憐憫也是殘忍。

words.note: Refers to sympathetic pity or mercy.

verses.text: 耕種自己田地的，也有充足的糧食；追求虛幻的，實在無知。
惡人貪慕壞人的網羅；義人的根得以結果。

words.note: Often implies desiring something forbidden or belonging to others.
Common metaphor for temptation or danger in the Bible.

words.definition: to be able to, so as to

words.note: Can also mean 'result' (n), but here it's a verb.

verses.text: 壞人嘴裡的過失，是自己的網羅；但義人必脫離患難。

words.definition: to break away from, to escape

verses.text: 人因口所結的果子必飽嘗美物；人手所作的必歸到他身上。

words.note: Indicates the preceding noun is the agent or means of the following verb.

words.definition: to return to, to come to

verses.text: 愚妄人所行的，在自己眼中看為正直，只有智慧人肯聽勸告。

words.definition: to regard as, to consider to be
to be willing to, to consent to

verses.text: 愚妄人的惱怒立時顯露，精明的人卻能忍受羞辱。

words.note: Common in wisdom literature

verses.text: 吐露真情的，彰顯正義，作假見證的卻是詭詐。

words.note: Indicates 'those who...'
More formal than simply 'show'
Often used in the context of 'bearing false witness'
Indicates 'those who...'
Can also be a noun meaning 'deceit'

verses.text: 有人說話不慎，好像利刀刺人，智慧人的舌頭卻能醫治人。

words.note: Verb-object compound
Common phrase in wisdom literature

verses.text: 說實話的嘴唇，永遠堅立；撒謊的舌頭，眨眼間消失。

words.note: Verb-object compound
Often used in biblical context for stability/endurance
Verb-object compound

verses.text: 圖謀惡事的，心存詭詐；使人和睦的，心中喜樂。

words.note: Indicates 'those who...'
Can also be an adjective meaning 'deceitful'
Indicates 'those who...'
Often refers to spiritual joy in biblical contexts

verses.text: 義人不會遭遇災禍，惡人卻飽經禍患。

words.note: Indicates possibility or future action.
Literally 'fully experience'.

verses.text: 撒謊的嘴唇是耶和華憎惡的；行事誠實是他所喜悅的。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'scatter lies'.
The personal name of God.
Forms an adjective/nominal phrase.
Often used to form a passive structure or emphasize object.

verses.text: 精明的人隱藏自己的知識，愚昧人的心卻顯出愚妄。

words.note: Refers to being sharp and clever.

verses.text: 殷勤人的手必掌權，懶惰人的手必作苦工。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Verb-object compound: 'grasp power'.
Literally 'bitter work'.

verses.text: 心中憂慮，使人消沉；一句良言使他歡喜。
義人作自己鄰舍的引導；惡人的道路，卻使別人走迷。

words.note: Refers to someone living nearby; biblical usage is common.
Verb-complement structure, often means to lose one's way or be confused.

verses.text: 懶惰的人不去燒烤他的獵物，殷勤的人卻得寶貴的財物（「殷勤的人卻得寶貴的財物」或譯：「人寶貴的財物是殷勤」）。

words.note: Often indicates an action will be performed.
Often used in a moral or religious context.
Common in biblical commentaries for alternative translations.
Here acting as a noun, 'diligence itself'.

verses.text: 在公義的路上有生命，這路徑之上沒有死亡（「這路徑之上沒有死亡」有古譯本作「邪惡的路，引到死亡」）。

words.note: Part of a locative phrase '路上' (on the road).
Connects nouns, similar to '的' but more formal/literary.
Part of a locative phrase '路徑之上' (on this path).
Refers to older manuscripts or translations of the Bible.
Used to introduce an alternative reading: '...is rendered as...'
